channel.title: Caffeine and Lasers - Blog
channel.description: Extended thoughts from Caffeine and Lasers

item.title: Transhumanism in a Technofeudal Society
item.description: I can not stop thinking about Peter Watts novel Blindsight (2006). It keeps me up at night thinking about its implications and what it says about humanity. Let me tell you about it.

item.title: On Personal Style And Role Models
item.description: I finally break my silence and share how I was STEMbofied

item.title: Virtual Lab Tour
item.description: A quick look around what I am working on these days

item.title: Where did ad supported media come from?
item.description: Where did the concept of "Advertisement Supported Content" even come from? It is more recent than you think

item.title: Post-Truth Marketing (and a Really Tasty Beer)
item.description: I rant about deceptive branding, nihilism and beer.

item.title: Another reason why libraries are great
item.description: They reduce this risk in picking books.

item.title: Beer And Optics
item.description: It is well known that Physicists have a special relationship with beer. There is just something magical about the amber fluid. Here I want to discuss the ways in which beer and the desire to improve the brewing process furthered humanities analytic chemistry techniques by clever applications of optical physics! We will be discussing the analytic colourimeter, and the refractometer.

item.title: On the role of technical skills in fighting power
item.description: If you are unhappy with the the powers that be, (regardless of who you think that is), you should understand the tools to fight them. Tip: Regulation wont be enough

item.title: My PhD Explained at 5 Levels
item.description: Finally getting round to explaining what I actually research

item.title: Embedding your latest Mastodon Post into your webpage
item.description: Quick tutorial on how to dynamically embed your latest mastodon post into your static webpage

item.title: Automating Your RSS Feed with 11ty
item.description: Here is a quick write-up on how to automate a little more of your personal website.

item.title: How I do My Research (As a PhD Student)
item.description: Yet another PhD student explains their personal knowledge management system.

item.title: Plant Monitor Prototype Update
item.description: Update on the development of a wireless plant monitor prototype, including its features, functionality, and goals.

item.title: Keep Your Ego In Check (Above The Robots)
item.description: The secret to effectively using LLMs is having a bigger ego than the AI. This blog post explores how to harness the power of AI while maintaining human strengths.

item.title: Introducing ChiScraper
item.description: Introducing ChiScraper, an open-source tool designed to help researchers streamline their ArXiv experience by combining keyword matching with LLM-powered ranking.

item.title: ChiCurate
item.description: Introducing ChiCurate, an open-source tool designed to help researchers streamline their ArXiv experience by combining keyword matching with LLM-powered ranking.

item.title: Where are all the aliens?
item.description: They arn't talking to us right now.

item.title: The Case For Power CoOps
item.description: Exploring the potential of supplier cooperatives in the power generation industry, particularly with the rise of solar panels and battery storage.

item.title: What Science Says About Coffee Grinding
item.description: Delving into the scientific aspects of coffee grinding, exploring the effects of electrostatic charges and strategies to mitigate them for a better cup of coffee.

item.title: LoFi Terminal
item.description: A minimalist audio player that does its job without any frills.

item.title: RSS
item.description: A short explainer on how to set-up your very own RSS feed

item.title: Perceptibility
item.description: Exploring the intersection of philosophy, psychology, and physics in understanding perception and the self.

item.title: An Introduction To LCOS
item.description: An introduction to Liquid Crystal on Silicon (LCOS) technology, covering its principles, applications, and the author's personal experience working with it.

item.title: From Student To Industry
item.description: This is a transcript for a talk I delivered to Joel Carpenters UQ Optics class in 2022. I found it in my notes and did not bother to re-read it before uploading. Feel free to yell at me if I\'ve made any mistakes

item.title: Anatomy of the Espresso
item.description: What even is an espresso?

item.title: RSS For Reddit
item.description: Learn how to use RSS to improve your Reddit experience by subscribing to subreddits anonymously and avoiding the Infinite Sludge Algorithm.
